medical_history.chief_complaint: Depressed mood with associated symptoms including irritability, social withdrawal, delusions of reference, and guilty ruminations.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ms. A had a 2-month history of depressed mood, irritability, social withdrawal, delusions of reference, and guilty ruminations. She experienced a 2-week history of decreased appetite, 2-kg weight loss, early and terminal insomnia, and inability to concentrate. Symptoms worsened when her steroid dose was tapered, leading to bizarre behavior, paranoid delusions, and command auditory hallucinations. Symptoms resolved with steroid increase and treatment with electroconvulsive therapy (ECT).
medical_history.past_medical_history: Systemic lupus erythematosus with a history of one previous psychiatric hospitalization a year prior to this admission; similar psychotic depression occurred 12 years previously after a stillbirth.
medical_history.social_history: 33-year-old secretary, maintaining steroid treatment during hospital stay.
